last_episode_to_air.name: Preserving Indigenous Culture: Part 2
last_episode_to_air.overview: Dylan journeys into Arnhem Land, where he participates in a welcoming ritual and films the customs and tribal lifeways of the Yolngu people.

name: Tales by Light
overview: Behind every powerful image is a powerful story. Uniting exploration, photography and the natural world, Tales By Light follows photographers from Australia and around the world as they push the limits of their craft.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: A look behind the photographs of talented Australian and North American photographers to see exactly what goes into capturing a powerful image.

episodes.name: Submerged
episodes.overview: Australian marine photographer Darren Jew captures mating humpback whales in Tonga, a 70-year-old biplane wreck and an active New Guinea volcano.

episodes.name: Himalaya
episodes.overview: Richard I'Anson documents a fire rite, attempts to photograph the elusive Himalayan snow leopard and captures the colorful Festival of Holi.

episodes.name: Adrenaline
episodes.overview: Intrepid adventure sports photographer Krystle Wright crafts images of free divers in Vanuatu, highliners in Colorado and paragliders in Utah.

episodes.name: Wild
episodes.overview: From brown bears in the rivers of Alaska to mountain gorillas in the jungles of Uganda, nature photographer Art Wolfe hunts for the perfect picture.

episodes.name: Panorama
episodes.overview: Following in the footsteps of explorer Ernest Shackleton, landscape photographer Peter Eastway travels to Antarctica to create stunning polar images.

episodes.name: Tribes
episodes.overview: Art Wolfe documents the world's cultures, including the Surma of Ethiopia and the masked mud men and Huli clans of Papua, New Guinea.

episodes.name: Sacred Nature: Part 1
episodes.overview: Hoping to ensure the park's survival, wildlife photographers Jonathan and Angela Scott document the native creatures of the Maasai Mara in Kenya.

episodes.name: Sacred Nature: Part 2
episodes.overview: Marveling at the abundant wildlife in the Mara's ecosystem, the Scotts photograph a cheetah, a Maasai ritual and an elusive leopard mother and cubs.

episodes.name: Misunderstood Predators: Part 1
episodes.overview: Underwater photographer Eric Cheng seeks the truth about demonized and mythologized creatures, starting with the green anaconda of Brazil.

episodes.name: Misunderstood Predators: Part 2
episodes.overview: To defend one of the world's most feared aquatic species, Eric Cheng and diver Jim Abernethy photograph human-friendly tiger sharks in the Bahamas.

episodes.name: Life and Death: Part 1
episodes.overview: After a career chronicling the horrors of war, photographer Stephen Dupont seeks to document a more poetic and dignified approach to death in India.

episodes.name: Life and Death: Part 2
episodes.overview: Stephen Dupont's quest for reverent depictions of life and death brings him to Namibia's deserts and the Bushmen of the Kalahari.

episodes.name: Children In Need: Part 1
episodes.overview: Documenting impoverished, at-risk children for UNICEF, photographer Simon Lister is joined in Bangladesh by goodwill ambassador Orlando Bloom.

episodes.name: Children In Need: Part 2
episodes.overview: Simon and Orlando continue their Bangladesh trip, visiting a makeshift school and photographing young children working in hazardous jobs for low pay.

episodes.name: Paradise in Peril: Part 1
episodes.overview: Undersea photographer Shawn Heinrichs fights to preserve the rapidly vanishing diversity of ocean life by capturing its beauty in dazzling images.

episodes.name: Paradise in Peril: Part 2
episodes.overview: Shawn continues his quest to conserve marine wildlife by capturing some arresting manta ray pictures in the Raja Ampat Islands of Indonesia.

episodes.name: Preserving Indigenous Culture: Part 1
episodes.overview: Dylan River continues a family tradition of filmmaking focused on the Aboriginal people of his native Australia with a tour of ancient rock art sites.

episodes.name: Preserving Indigenous Culture: Part 2
episodes.overview: Dylan journeys into Arnhem Land, where he participates in a welcoming ritual and films the customs and tribal lifeways of the Yolngu people.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview: A look behind the photographs of talented Australian and North American photographers to see exactly what goes into capturing a powerful image.
